message:
Archiving Egyptian Geeks:
A while ago I saw at least couple of scripts for extracting/downloading the data of this page (posts, comments, etc.).
I was thinking maybe we can run those scripts on weekly basis, extract the data, then put it up on GitHub and serve it as a static website. It would be an archive for the group that is searchable by search engines.
We can add search box that uses a search engine to help... I don't know.... find an old post about a script that downloads the content of this page.

data.message: Emad Elsaid Has already some code to get all the group posts :)
I couldn't remember who wrote it. Thanks :)
Or once we extract them we can import them to the blog!
Yup I think Emad Elsaid wrote a script that does so. Great idea guys!

yup, this script does download posts but it analyze them to generate hall of fame, it could be twisted to save them as HTML with timestamp of generate them with jekyll or octopress https://github.com/blazeeboy/RubyScripts/blob/67e99ba220a8d732bc81a8fc2d57a6c1f90daa51/2014-03-20/facebook-group-hall-of-fame.rb
Amr I can help in this task, I can save them in any form you want and we can decide if we add them as markdown or import them to the blog
If we can save it in some kind of JSON and then use Handlebar.js or Mustache.js for templating. This would be better. Later on, if we wanna move the data anywhere, we can.
I created this repo for the script https://github.com/egygeeks/fb_group_archiver
Sweet!

This PowerShell script archives wall posts
http://www.cob.org/data/facebook/
Source code
https://github.com/City-of-Bellingham/SocialMediaArchivers/
May by try to categorize those data also...
I think this will reopen porting to another platform discussion

I support the JSON idea, specially because Facebook's APIs return the data as JSON so you can easily aggregate that, that way we have all the data we need and don't need then we choose the stuff we want to display in the view

I altered the bot I created for facebook a while ago a little bit so that it could fetch the entire feed of a given group, tested it here and managed to pull the entire archive in JSON format, 
https://github.com/kashwaa/fb_group_archiver/blob/master/egy_geeks_archive.txt
Note that it's a dump of graph api original output, I think it should be cleaned up a bit to only keep the information needed to create static pages, i.e the creator's name and id, posting date, message,link and image and get rid of the rest, I believe I can work on it further to categorize posts and give different output formats, xml or even database dump, it could be run periodically to fetch the new posts every day or so
Please notice that the file is a very large text file (almost 8MB). Opening it directly in a text editor can cause your computer/app to hang.

Some suggestions for how to open Large Text files
http://stackoverflow.com/a/159537/463

Kareem Kashwaa this is excellent. Well done.
When you pull the archive, are you getting the whole thing, or within a certain date or what?
I think the next step is to break down this large JSON object into smaller files. Maybe one for each post. Then we can use a templating JS library to display the post on screen.
We get to select a time limit or number of posts to extract, I could provide a separate file for each post, I was going to go ahead and convert it into html files with separate file per post.

You don't have to convert them to HTML
We can have a single HTML page (with JS code) and just read the JSON file to render the page on the client side.
Look at this project. I've used Mustach.js to do the same thing.
http://amreldib.github.io/JsapiTypescriptSamples/index.html
Here's the HTML page (with the JS code)
https://github.com/AmrEldib/JsapiTypescriptSamples/blob/master/index.html
And the JSON file
https://github.com/AmrEldib/JsapiTypescriptSamples/blob/master/samples.json
If we have one HTML page that points to different JSON files, we'll have the same result.

Is the current format alright? it seems bloated with so much unneeded data that we can discard to make files smaller and life simpler,
where will it be hosted?

It can be hosted on GitHub.
I need to look at the current format to see what's extra. If extra info are there, they can be kept and just not displayed on screen.

https://github.com/kashwaa/fb_group_archiver/blob/master/posts.zip
separate file/post
Fantastic!
Great job, Kareem. Can you put your code in the repo as well?
Yeah, and if you can rename the files to JSON instead of Text (or export them again as JSON)
